intro: Tithymalus akenocarpus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, finely divided leaves that give it a delicate appearance. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers, which are typically arranged in umbels. It is native to temperate regions of Europe and prefers well-drained soils in sunny to partially shaded locations. Tithymalus akenocarpus is often grown as an ornamental plant for its attractive foliage and subtle floral display.
